text:
when using basic authentication, .htaccess files and setting passwd with
htpasswd i have found:

when logging in using firefox 1.0.2, assuming you enter the correct username,
when entering password, again assuming the password is entered correctly, you
can append the passwd entry with any number of any characters and access will
still be granted. this does not apply to the username, this must be entered
exactly as stated.
creator: cancense@hotmail.com

text:
This is, because you're using 3DES-crypt, which is limited to 8 pw-chars. Use
MD5-crypt (htpwassd -m) instead.
creator: nd@perlig.de
